Object.description: The mime-type of the request document.
Object.name: content-type

Object.description: the description of the attachment.
Object.name: x-document-description

Object.description: The x-public-uri
Object.name: x-public-uri

Object.description: The comma separated group by columns.
Object.name: gbcols

Object.description: The order by clause for the group by query. Follows the same syntax as oslc.orderBy.
Object.name: gbsortby

Object.description: The range clause for the group by query.
Object.name: gbrange

Object.description: If set to 1, it will instruct the api to include the total count of records that matched the query ( responseInfo.totalCount). By default it will not return that unless the maximo property mxe.oslc.collectioncount is set to 1. This is a recommended way to control collection count at the request level.
Object.name: collectioncount

Object.description: The mime-type of the accept document.
Object.name: accept

Object.description: This request header with the value of MERGE will instruct the server to treat a PATCH request (POST with x-method-override as PATCH) processor to merge the child objects (array of child objects) in the request with the corresponding child elements in the server. If this header is not present, the server will delete the child objects that are missing from the request.
Object.name: patchtype

Object.description:
Filter clause following the OSLC query syntax
(see below for more details on this)
Object.name: oslc.select

Object.description: Uniqic Child Object id
Object.name: childObjectID

Object.description: The maxauth header for authentication
Object.name: maxauth

Object.description: Unique id for object structure resource
Object.name: id

Object.description: For a create/update/delete, if the request wants to suppress the object events, this request header needs to be set to 0. By default all events are fired unless programmatically stopped.
Object.name: x-allow-events

Object.description: Uniqie attachemnt id
Object.name: docid

Object.description: If set to true, will instruct the server to page the resource from a in session MboSet.
Object.name: stablepaging

Object.description: This is used to prevent de-duplication for create/update/delete. If this header is present then the value is compared to a list of committed transaction ids.If it has a match, then it is considered as a duplicate transaction and an HTTP conflict error is generated.
Object.name: transactionid

Object.description: List of Actions that can be performed on a resource
Object.name: action

Object.description: Instruct the server to page the query response based on the default page size. The default page size needs to be configured on the server side for this to take effect.
Object.name: oslc.paging

Object.description: There is a limitation in HTTP which prevents non-ISO-8859-1 characters in any request header value. To set descriptions in other character sets,base64 encode this value and then set the value in the x-document-encdescription header.This should be used instead of x-document-description
Object.name: x-document-encdescription

Object.description: Where clause to filter the set of resources
Object.name: oslc.where

Object.description: if set to 1, this will cause the oslc.where clause to set the query mode to OR clause instead of AND.
Object.name: opmodeor

Object.description: Select clause for selecting a partial view of the member resource.
Object.name: properties

Object.description: Sort clause for the query.
Object.name: oslc.orderBy

Object.description: Record wide text search for tokens specified as this query parameter value. Example oslc.searchTerms="pump","broken"
Object.name: oslc.searchTerms

Object.description: If set to 1, this will instruct the api to work with the "lean" json format as opposed to the namespaced json that it produces by default. This option is supported only starting 7601 release of the Maximo base. Its preferred to use this format as it reduces the size of the json payload.
Object.name: lean

Object.description: IIf set to 1, it will drop all hrefs for child collections.
Object.name: ignorecollectionref

Object.description: Default value is 0. For attachments/doclinks, if set to 1, it will inline the attachment blob as base64 encoded string inside the json response.
Object.name: inlinedoc

Object.description: Default value is 1. If set to 0, the json response will include attributes with null values also.
Object.name: _dropnulls

Object.description: Default value is 0. If set to 1, all the objects in the bulk call would be committed or rolled back. No partial commit.
Object.name: allornothing

Object.description: Saved Query
Object.name: savedQuery

Object.description: Set to the users apikey. This is used when the 'api' context is used (instead of 'oslc'). Do make sure that the apikey is generated for the user. You can use the Administration app to generate an apikey
Object.name: apikey

Object.description: A sample header value for OOTB Maximo is FILE/Attachments. Do make sure that the attachments setup is completed on the Maximo server side before attempting to use this api feature.
Object.name: x-document-meta

Object.description: The name of the attached document file. An example pump.jpeg.
Object.name: slug

Object.description: The base64 encoded name of the attached document file. This is needed when the file name has non-ascii characters. In all this one should be used instead of 'slug'
Object.name: encslug

Object.description: Due to constraints from browser the HTTP POST method is re-used for creates and updates and deletes.This request header is used to convey the specifics of the POST request. PATCH is used for update. DELETE is used for deleting the resource. BULK is used for supporting bulk operations.If this header is not present, the POST request is treated as a create request.
Object.name: x-method-override

Object.description: Instruct the server to page the query result with the specified page size.
Object.name: oslc.pageSize

Object.description: Select clause for selecting a partial view of the member resource (like an individual workorder).
Object.name: oslc.properties
